description: From Middle English loved, luvd, from Old English lufode, first and third person singular past indicative of lufian; and Middle English loved, iloved, from Old English ġelufod, past participle of lufian; both equivalent to love +‎ -ed.

adjectives.description: loved (comparative more loved, superlative most loved)

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of love
